history.text: Hello
Hi, how are you?
I'm doing ok.
I'm thinking about a movie which is based off a true story and portrays the life of a Frank Abagnale.
It stars Leonardo DiCaprio and Tom Hanks.
I’ve never heard of him, what did he do for a living?
The movie is called Catch Me If You Can.
Have you seen it? It got very good reviews on Rotten Tomatoes.
I have not seen it, what is it about?
It's about a man named Frank Abagnale (played by DiCaprio) who is a con man primarily through check fraud.
The detective on his trail is Carl Hanratty (Tom Hanks) who chases his all over the world, thus the title Catch Me If You Can.
Oh that sounds interesting. What year did the movie come out?
Movie was released in 2002 and it got high ratings through several different review sites.
Is he part of a gang or does he commit the crimes on his own?
He's on his own and does the fraud throughout his teen years.
He successfully impersonated a pilot, a doctor, a parish and in the end when he was caught, he ended up working for the FBI
Sounds interesting.
Yes, his impersonation of an airline pilot was with Pan Am and it netted him $2.8 million.
It's based in NY as well.
How long is the movie?
Yea, about that, the movie is a bit long at 2.5 hours but overall I would say it's a must see.
That’s not too bad. Is there plenty of action to keep you entertained?
Not really much action but the storyline keeps you interested.
Is there anything else I should know about the movie?
In one scene where Frank Abagnale is caught, the detectives are extraditing him back to the US by plane. Abagnale goes to use the bathroom on the plane and escapes.
Eventually though, Carl catches up to him and Frank gives himself up and is sentenced to prison.
And this is based on a true story?
Carl occasionally visits him and through conversation and review of evidenced together, Frank ends up working for the FBI with Carl.
Yes, it's based on a true story but they probably dramatized some parts of the story.
Any other questions?
I feel it's a good movie for all.
Hello?
